Welcome to the orientation module for PSYC 2740! We will cover everything here and more on the first day of class. See you there.

## Goals

- Quick course orientation
- Discuss the open science movement and the replication crisis
- Review research methods and design principles

## Instructions 

Work through each of the following Prep, Try, and Apply sections. The Prep section will provide details on all the assigned material for Tuesday and Thursday each week. The Try section will contain any slides/links that may be used during class as well as details about quizzes you may need to complete in a given week. The Apply section will provide instructions about the formative and/or project assignment(s) due at the end of the week.

### Before Tuesday

Read the syllabus for this course. If you have questions about the syllabus, then please ask them in class or by annotating the syllabus on Canvas.

<a class="btn btn-outline-info" href="../course_docs/syllabus.html" role="button" >Read</a>

### Before Thursday

- Complete the experiment using the link on Canvas
- Read the paper (PDF on Canvas): 

>> Frank, M. C., & Saxe, R. (2012). Teaching replication. Perspectives on Psychological Science, 7(6), 600-604.

### After Thursday

- Read the [QALMRI + SPARK tutorial](https://teaching-me.github.io/coglab/articles/course_docs/QALMRI_SPARK.html) on the course website

- Read the paper (PDF on Canvas): 

>> Savic, O., Unger, L., & Sloutsky, V. M. (2022). Exposure to co-occurrence regularities in language drives semantic integration of new words. <i>Journal of Experimental Psychology: Learning, Memory, and Cognition, 48</i>(7), 1064.
